articles.headline: Deal at Risk, Buyers Warn Sallie Mae
articles.snippet: A consortium that had agreed to buy the student lender Sallie Mae for $25 billion said Wednesday that it was unwilling to complete the deal at the current price.
articles.abstract: A consortium that had agreed to buy the student lender Sallie Mae for $25 billion said Wednesday that it was unwilling to complete the deal at the current price.
articles.lead_paragraph: A private spat has become a public brawl.
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Myanmar Raids Monasteries Before Dawn
articles.snippet: Security forces in Myanmar went into at least two Buddhist monasteries early today, beating and arresting dozens of monks.
articles.abstract: Security forces in Myanmar went into at least two Buddhist monasteries early today, beating and arresting dozens of monks.
articles.lead_paragraph: BANGKOK, Sept. 27 — Beginning the second day of their crackdown on nationwide protests in Myanmar before dawn today, security forces raided at least two Buddhist monasteries, beating and arresting dozens of monks, according to reports from the capital, Yangon.

articles.headline: Buffett Said to Consider Bear Stake
articles.snippet: Bear Stearns is in serious talks to sell as much as 20 percent of the firm, with several individual investors, including Warren E. Buffett, expressing an interest.
articles.abstract: Bear Stearns is in serious talks to sell as much as 20 percent of the firm, with several individual investors, including Warren E. Buffett, expressing an interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bear Stearns, its shares and reputation beaten down after the collapse of two hedge funds, has held talks with several investors, including Warren E. Buffett, concerning a possible sale of as much as 20 percent of the firm, people briefed on the discussions said yesterday.

articles.headline: A Cellphone Without Borders
articles.snippet: Early next month, a small company called Cubic Telecom will release what it’s calling the first global mobile phone.
articles.abstract: Early next month, a small company called Cubic Telecom will release what it’s calling the first global mobile phone.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s amazing the way the Internet keeps toppling traditional businesses. Telegrams have gone away. Music CD sales are tanking. Newspapers are hurting.

articles.headline: Off the Picket Line at G.M., Relieved but Wary
articles.snippet: U.A.W. workers remain concerned but hopeful about the settlement’s health care and job security provisions.
articles.abstract: U.A.W. workers remain concerned but hopeful about the settlement’s health care and job security provisions.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROMULUS, Mich., Sept. 26 — The parking lot at the General Motors engine plant here was full again Wednesday afternoon. Near one of the factory’s driveways, the only signs there had been a strike were a charred metal barrel and a portable Weber grill filled with ashes, abandoned in the middle of the night, when news of a tentative contract agreement had arrived just ahead of a rainstorm.
articles.byline: By Nick Bunkley and Mary M. Chapman

articles.headline: With U.A.W. Accord, G.M. Looks to a New Detroit
articles.snippet: G.M. has taken a major step toward eliminating much of the burden of providing benefits for its current and former workers.
articles.abstract: G.M. has taken a major step toward eliminating much of the burden of providing benefits for its current and former workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: For a generation, executives at the Detroit auto companies have complained that the huge cost of providing generous benefits for its unionized workers put them at a competitive disadvantage with surging foreign car companies like Toyota and Honda.

articles.headline: Verizon Blocks Messages of Abortion Rights Group
articles.snippet: Verizon Wireless denied a request from Naral Pro-Choice America to use its network for a text-message program.
articles.abstract: Verizon Wireless denied a request from Naral Pro-Choice America to use its network for a text-message program.
articles.lead_paragraph: Saying it had the right to block “controversial or unsavory” text messages, Verizon Wireless has rejected a request from Naral Pro-Choice America, the abortion rights group, to make Verizon’s mobile network available for a text-message program.

articles.headline: Blackwater Tops Firms in Iraq in Shooting Rate
articles.snippet: Blackwater USA has been involved in a far higher rate of shootings in Iraq than other security firms providing similar services, officials say.
articles.abstract: Blackwater USA has been involved in a far higher rate of shootings in Iraq than other security firms providing similar services, officials say.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26 — The American security contractor Blackwater USA has been involved in a far higher rate of shootings while guarding American diplomats in Iraq than other security firms providing similar services to the State Department, according to Bush administration officials and industry officials.
articles.byline: By John M. Broder and James Risen

articles.headline: The Mideast Money Flows
articles.snippet: The financial influence of Dubai and its neighbors is raising political concerns among U.S. lawmakers.
articles.abstract: The financial influence of Dubai and its neighbors is raising political concerns among U.S. lawmakers.
articles.lead_paragraph: As head of the Carlyle Group, David M. Rubenstein is a regular at power lunches along the New York-Washington corridor.
